1.original_question: Billing
1.answer:
You can manage your billing and subscription details easily on BIGVU, whether you're using the web platform or the mobile app.

### On the Web Platform:
1. Log in to your account at [https://desk.bigvu.tv/login](https://desk.bigvu.tv/login).
2. Click on the Profile icon at the top right of the page.
3. Select "Billing" from the drop-down menu to access your subscription information.

### Billing Page Options:
1. **Plan Details**: View and change your current plan.
2.

**Invoice Details**: Enter your personal or company details for invoicing.
3.

**Payment Method**: Click the "update" button to change your payment method.
4.

**Cancel Plan**: End your current subscription by clicking this button.

Your billing history will be displayed at the bottom of the page.

### On the Mobile App:
1. Open the BIGVU app.
2. Click on the profile icon at the far right of the bottom menu.
3. Tap on "My Subscription" to view your current plan and make changes.

Remember, any changes to billing or upgrading must be completed through the platform on which you originally purchased your subscription.

3.answer:
Yes, you can definitely insert your logo into BIGVU to make your video projects more professional and personalized. Here's how you can do it:

1. **Upload Your Logo**:
   - Go to the Branding section on the left side menu.
   - Click on the plus button to add your logo.

2. **Choose Your Video**:
   - On the project screen, open the relevant video you want to add a logo to.
   - Select the video, click on the 3 dots menu, and choose Edit.
   - The Take Screen will open. Select the desired take by clicking the three-dot menu beneath its name.
   - A pop-up window will appear, offering you the option to choose "Open Video Maker" to stylize your video.

3. **Add Your Logo**:
   - In Video Maker, at the bottom of the video, you will be able to add a Logo.
   - Click on Add logo and choose your added logo. Your logo will appear at the top of the video.
   - You can also upload your logo directly in this window by clicking on the plus button. Once your logo is selected, click on Save at the bottom to add your logo.

This feature is available on the web platform and mobile app for users with Starter, AI Pro, and Team Pro Plans.

4.original_question: aside from picture overlay, can insert a slide/photo in between cuts?
4.answer:
Yes, you can insert a slide or photo into your video using BIGVU. Here's how you can do it:

1. **Open the Video Maker**: Start by opening the video you want to edit. Click the three dots beneath the title of the video on the project page and select "Edit". Then, click on the three dots of the selected take and choose "Open Video Maker".

2. **Upload Your Photo**: In the Video Maker, click on the "Uploads" icon on the left sidebar and select "Upload" on the top to import your files. You can upload JPG, PNG, or MP4 files.

3.

**Insert the Photo**: Drag and drop your uploaded photo onto the small photo in the storyboard to add it to your chosen timeframe. This will insert the photo into your video sequence.

4. **Adjust as Needed**: You can delete the inserted photo by clicking on the three-dots menu of the related segment and selecting "Remove Media". Once you're satisfied with your edits, click "Create" on the top right of the Video Maker screen to apply the changes.

This way, you can seamlessly insert slides or photos between your video cuts, making your video more engaging and dynamic.

3.original_question: how do I configure 2FA?
3.answer:
To configure 2FA (or MFA) in OpenVPN Connect, follow these steps:

1. Launch OpenVPN Connect.
2. Click or tap on the desired profile.
3. Successfully authenticate with your profile's authentication method. The MFA prompt displays.
4. Enter the one-time password and click Send.
5. You are connected.

For more details, you can refer to the [Multi-factor Authentication (MFA)](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/mfa.html) documentation.

1. Log in to the Admin Web UI.
2. Navigate to Authentication > General.
3. Enable the "Require MFA" option.
4. Save the settings.

For more detailed instructions, refer to the Access Server MFA documentation.

1.original_question: can i download a BigVU recorded video to my computer, iPad or iPhone?
1.answer:
Yes, you can download a BIGVU recorded video to your computer, iPad, or iPhone. Here’s how you can do it:

### Download to Your Computer
1. **Unedited (Script) Project**:
   - Select the Script project video you want to download.
   - Click on the 3 dots and choose "Edit".
   - In the take screen, choose the take you want to download by clicking on the 3-dot menu.
   - Select "Download" and choose the format: MP4 or WebM.

2.

**Edited (Video Maker) Project**:
   - Click on the 3 dots menu of the Video Maker Project and select "Download".
   - Choose the type of file you wish to download: MP4 or WebM.

### Download to Your iPad or iPhone
1. **Using the Mobile App**:
   - Access the Projects page (bottom left icon).
   - Choose the video you want to download.
   - On the next screen, select the video take you will be sharing.
   - Click the share button at the bottom of the screen.
   - Choose "Download File" to download your video to your device.

2.original_question: I just created a script on my laptop now I want to get it ready to add to the teleprompter to start recording

Great! Here's how you can get your script ready for the teleprompter and start recording:

1. **Open your app**: Make sure you have the BIGVU app installed on your device (iPhone, iPad, or Android).
2.

**Create a new script**: You can use the AI Script Generator or write one from scratch. If you've already created your script on your laptop, it should be saved in your projects.
3.

**Access the Teleprompter**: Once your script is ready, click on the camera icon in the script screen to enter the Teleprompter mode.
4.

**Allow Permissions**: Some popups will appear to let BIGVU access Speech Recognition, Camera, and Microphone. Make sure to allow these permissions.
5.

**Adjust Teleprompter Settings**: Change the size of the text box, font size, speed, and scroll position to suit your reading pace and comfort.
6.

**Start Recording**: Rotate your phone if you want your video displayed in landscape or portrait. When you’re ready, tap the record button. After a 5-second countdown, the text will begin to scroll, and the camera will start recording. Tap the record button again to stop at any time.

That's it! You're now ready to record your script using the teleprompter.

3.original_question: how can I use the teleprompter and script to record on my laptop
3.answer:
To use the BIGVU teleprompter and script to record on your laptop, follow these steps:

1. **Open Your Account**: Log in to your BIGVU account on any web browser by heading to [http://desk.bigvu.tv](http://desk.bigvu.tv/).

2.

**Create a New Script**: Click on "New Script" and create your script. You can type your script directly or copy and paste it into the script input box. For more details on creating a script, check [here](https://faq.bigvu.tv/en/articles/7191767-how-to-write-a-video-script-with-ai-or-from-scratch).

3. **Read and Record**: Once your script is ready, choose the "Read and Record" option.

4.

**Camera & Microphone Permissions**: When prompted by your browser, allow BIGVU to access your camera and microphone.

5. **Teleprompter Settings**: Adjust the teleprompter settings to your comfort. You can change the font size, speed, and scroll position. For more details on settings, visit the [Teleprompter Settings](https://faq.bigvu.tv/en/articles/6164203-what-are-the-parts-and-key-features-of-the-bigvu-teleprompter-in-webdesk) guide.

6.

**Start Recording**: Click the Record button to start recording your video. To end the recording, simply click the Record button again.

7. **Pause Recording**: If you need to pause during recording, press the spacebar and resume using the same button.

8. **Upload and Download**: After recording, a dialog box showing a preview of the video will open. You can then upload or download your video as needed.

That's it! You're all set to create professional videos using the BIGVU teleprompter on your laptop.

*[Try it now on your project? it's free!](https://bigvu.sng.link/Db284/ot3k?wpsrc=button&_smtype=3&utm_medium=chatbot&utm_source=bigvu.tv&utm_content=background_remove&utm_campaign=edit_tools&_fallback_redirect=https://desk.bigvu.tv/welcome/init/upload).*

1.original_question: How do I export videos I created on the big phone app to my computer
1.answer:
To export videos you created on the BIGVU app to your computer, follow these steps:

1. **Upload to the Cloud**: First, upload your video to the cloud. This will make the download process faster and more reliable.
2.

**Select Your Project**: Choose the project you want to download. This could be an unedited (Script) project or an edited (Video Maker) project.
3.

**Download the Video**:
   - For **Unedited (Script) Projects**:
     - Select the Script project video you want to download.
     - Click on the 3 dots and choose "Edit".
     - In the take screen, click on the 3-dot menu of the take you want to download.
     - Select "Download" and choose the format (MP4 or WebM).
   - For **Edited (Video Maker) Projects**:
     - Click on the 3 dots menu of the Video Maker Project.
     - Select "Download".
     - Choose the type of file you wish to download (MP4 or WebM).

By following these steps, you can easily export your videos from the BIGVU app to your computer.

3.answer:
Thanks for using Connexa!

To limit the number of devices for CloudConnexa, you can configure the device allowance per User Group. Here's a brief overview:

1. **Set the default device allowance for Users**:
   - Navigate to Settings > Users.
   - Click Edit in the top right corner.
   - In the Device Allowance section, enter the new number of allowed Devices.
   - Click Update and confirm the changes.

2. **Change the device allowance for a specific User Group**:
   - When creating a new User Group, set the device allowance as needed.
   - For existing User Groups, edit the group settings to adjust the device allowance.

For more details, refer to the [Set the default device allowance for Users](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/settings/settings---users/set-the-default-device-allowance-for-users.html) and [Edit a User Group](https://openvpn.net/edit-a-user-group.html) documentation.

2.original_question: how can I configure RADIUS for access server?
2.answer:
Thanks for asking! To configure RADIUS for Access Server, follow these steps:

1. **Add a new RADIUS client**:
   - Open Server Manager on your Windows Server.
   - Click Tools > Network Policy Server.
   - Under NPS, expand RADIUS Clients and Servers.
   - Right-click RADIUS Clients and click New.
   - Enter the information for your new RADIUS client:
     - Friendly name: Enter a descriptive name such as "Access Server".
     - Address (IP or DNS): Enter the public IP address of your Access Server.
     - Shared Secret: Click the Generate radio button, then click Generate below.
   - Click OK.

2.

**Configure RADIUS with Access Server**:
   - Sign in to the Admin Web UI.
   - Click Authentication > RADIUS.
   - Enable RADIUS authentication.
   - Enter the RADIUS server details in Hostname or IP Address.
   - Enter the shared secret from the RADIUS server in Shared Secret.
   - Select MS-CHAP v2 (recommended) as the RADIUS Authentication Method.

For more detailed steps, refer to the [Tutorial: Configure Active Directory (Windows Server) RADIUS Protocol for Access Server](https://openvpn.net/as-docs/tutorials/tutorial--microsoft-ad-radius.html).

You can also configure RADIUS from your Access Server console using the command-line interface. Refer to [Authentication options and command line configuration](https://openvpn.net/vpn-server-resources/authentication-options-and-command-line-configuration/).

1.original_question: I want to record a script
1.answer:
Great! Here's how you can record a script using BIGVU:

1. **Create or Select a Script**: First, you need to create or select a script. You can write one from scratch or use the AI Magic Writer to generate one for you.

2. **Edit Your Script**: Once your script is ready, you can edit it if needed. Look for the scroll icon on the projects page to confirm it's a script project. Click on the three dots under the video thumbnail to edit your script.

3. **Read & Record**: When you're satisfied with your script, you can start recording. Choose the "Read & Record" option to read your script from the teleprompter while recording.

4. **Practice**: If you want to practice before recording, you can use the "Read Only" option. Your microphone and camera will be off while you practice reading your script.

5. **Live Stream**: If you want to broadcast live on social media, you can use the "Live Stream" option to read from the teleprompter while live streaming.

6. **Save and Record Later**: If you're not ready to record immediately, you can save your script and record it later when you're ready.

After recording, you can add your business card to the video for an eye-catching way to share your contact details.

1.original_question: Hi! I need to have subtitles in spanish language from my video in spanish but it is not happening. What should i do
1.answer:
Hi! You can easily add subtitles in Spanish to your video using BIGVU. Here's how you can do it:

1. **Web Platform**:
   - After recording your video, go to the take screen by clicking the three dots under your script project and selecting "edit."
   - Choose the take you want to add subtitles to and click on the three dots.
   - Select "Generate Subtitles and Translations."
   - On the next screen, choose the Translate option.
   - Set "Translate from" to Spanish (the original language of your video).
   - Set "Translate to" to Spanish as well.
   - Click "Create Subtitles."

2. **Mobile App**:
   - In the video maker, tap the three dots on the top right side of the screen and select "Translate Subtitles."
   - Tap the "translate into another language" button.
   - Choose Spanish as both the original speech language and the language you want your subtitles to be translated to.
   - Press "Create Subtitles."

Once the subtitles are generated, you can edit and share your video with the new subtitles.

*[Try it now on your project? it's free!](https://bigvu.sng.link/Db284/ot3k?wpsrc=button&_smtype=3&utm_medium=chatbot&utm_source=bigvu.tv&utm_content=ai_script&utm_campaign=script_tools&_fallback_redirect=https://desk.bigvu.tv/welcome/init/business-profile).*

2.original_question: remove from this website
2.answer:
If you want to delete your BIGVU account from the website, follow these steps:

1. Log in to your account on the [Web](https://desk.bigvu.tv/login).
2. Click on your Profile Picture in the top-right corner to access your profile page.
3. On the left-hand menu, click "Preferences."
4. Scroll down to the "Data and Privacy" section.
5. Choose "Delete Account."
6. Enter your email address in the pop-up box and click "Delete."

Remember, deleting your account does not cancel your subscription. Make sure to [cancel your subscription first](https://faq.bigvu.tv/en/articles/8016888-cancel-subscription), or you will continue to be billed. Also, once deleted, it is impossible to recover your video projects, scripts, media assets, and videos. It's a good idea to export all your videos and scripts from the BIGVU desk before deleting your account.

1.original_question: How does the teleprompter work when the camera is above the computer monitor?
1.answer:
When using a teleprompter with the camera positioned above your computer monitor, it's important to maintain eye contact with the camera to engage your viewers effectively. Here are some tips to help you achieve this:

1. **Text Size**: Keep the text as close to the camera as possible. Adjust the font size to be as small as you can comfortably read. This helps keep your eyes near the camera, making it appear as if you're looking directly at your audience.

2.

**Reading Position**: Always read the top lines of the teleprompter script, as they are closest to the camera. Avoid reading the bottom lines as they come into view, as this will take your eyes further away from the camera.

3.

**Teleprompter Speed**: Adjust the teleprompter speed to match your natural speaking pace. This ensures you can comfortably read the top lines without rushing or slowing down too much.

By following these tips, you can create a more engaging and professional video presentation, even with the camera positioned above your monitor.

3.answer:
Thanks! To install OpenVPN Connect on Windows, follow these steps:

1. Download the [OpenVPN Connect app from our website](https://openvpn.net/client/client-connect-vpn-for-windows/).
2. Open the downloaded file.
3. Run the OpenVPN Connect setup wizard.
4. Agree to the EULA and install.
5. Approve the privilege escalation request when prompted.
6. Click Finish when the installation completes.
7. From your system tray, click the OpenVPN Connect icon to launch the app.

For more details, check the [Windows installation guide](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/installation-guide-windows.html).

4.original_question: what is profile?
4.answer:
Connection profiles in OpenVPN Connect are .ovpn text files that contain the directives, parameters, and certificates required to establish the client-server VPN connection. These profiles include addresses and ports to contact the server, information for verifying peer identity, securing the TLS control channel, and other settings.

For more details, you can refer to the [Connection Profiles documentation](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/connection-profiles.html).

5.original_question: how do I connect to Access Server?
5.answer:
Thanks for asking! To connect to Access Server with OpenVPN Connect, follow these steps:

1. Open a browser and enter the URL for the Client Web UI (the IP address or hostname of the server hosting Access Server).
2. Enter your username and password, then click Sign In.
3. Click on the icon to download the recommended version of OpenVPN Connect for your device.
4. Wait for the download to complete, then install OpenVPN Connect.
5. Launch the app, click through the tutorial, and agree to the EULA.
6. Click on your profile to connect. If prompted, enter your password.

For more detailed steps, you can refer to the [Windows installation guide](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/installation-guide-windows.html).

If you need to use SAML authentication, follow the steps in the [SAML authentication guide](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/tutorials/saml-with-access-server.html).

1.original_question: Morning,  I need to do a video reading from a scrip.
1.answer:
Good morning! You can easily create a video reading from a script using BIGVU's teleprompter feature. Here's a step-by-step guide to get you started:

1. **Write Your Script**:
   - Click on the "New Script" button on the Projects page.
   - Enter your script headline in "Title of the script". This will be the name of your video project.
   - You can use the "AI Rewrite Button" to help generate a script if needed.

2.

**Set Up the Teleprompter**:
   - Position yourself correctly based on whether you're recording horizontally or vertically. For horizontal recording, position yourself close to the camera. For vertical recording, position yourself in the middle of the screen.
   - Make sure the text appears in a position where your eyes don't travel too much while reading. Keep your eyes on the first line to maintain direct eye contact with your audience.

3. **Practice Reading**:
   - Use the "Read Only" mode to practice reading your script from the teleprompter without recording. This will help you get comfortable with the script and avoid stumbling during the actual recording.

4.

**Record Your Video**:
   - Once you're ready, hit the record button and start reading your script from the teleprompter. Remember to smile and relax before starting the recording to appear more natural on camera.

5. **Edit and Finalize**:
   - After recording, you can edit your video, add captions, and even include a thumbnail to make it more engaging.

If you need more detailed tips on using the teleprompter, you can check out our [Teleprompter Tips and Tricks](https://faq.bigvu.tv/en/articles/5095039-how-to-use-a-teleprompter-tips-and-tricks) guide.

*Want to try out the Voice Generation? Just click [here](https://bigvu.sng.link/Db284/ot3k?wpsrc=button&_smtype=3&utm_medium=chatbot&utm_source=bigvu.tv&utm_content=voice_generate&utm_campaign=video_create_tools&_fallback_redirect=https://desk.bigvu.tv/welcome/init/audiogram)*. Once you are inside the system, write your script, and then choose "AI Voice Generator" from the left menu. Happy video making!

1.original_question:
Las moléculas –o especies– homonucleares (homo ‘igual’) están compuestas solo por un elemento. Pueden consistir en varios átomos, según las propiedades del elemento, y algunos de estos pueden poseer varios alótropos.
Los gases nobles constituyen casos excepcionales de moléculas de un solo átomo (monoatómicas), debido a que raramente forman enlaces (combinaciones químicas). Como corroboración de la similitud de propiedades de los elementos, componen el grupo 18 (8A o VIIIA) de la tabla periódica. Sin embargo, la mayoría de las moléculas homonucleares son diatómicas: hidrógeno (H2), oxígeno (O2), nitrógeno (N2) y todos los halógenos; no obstante, no todas las moléculas diatómicas son homonucleares.
También existen moléculas homonucleares de más de dos átomos. Por ejemplo, el oxígeno, además de su molécula diatómica, también constituye la molécula triatómica homonuclear ozono (O3). Así mismo, existen moléculas tetratómicas: arsénico (As4) y fósforo (P4). El azufre tiene tres variaciones moleculares homonucleares: diatómica (S2), hexatómica (S6) y octatómica (S8), aunque las dos primeras son raras. El elemento carbono se caracteriza por constituir varias moléculas homonucleares, entre las que destaca el buckminsterfullereno o buckybola (C60).

1.original_question: Don't need an Ai generated script.  How do I upload my own?
1.answer:
Sure, you can upload your own script easily! Here's how you can do it:

### On Mobile (iOS):
1. Click on the "+" button in the center of the bottom menu and choose "New Script."
2. Enter your Project title. This will also be the name of the video you create from the script.
3. Type in your own script or upload an existing script into the text box. Note that the upload option is currently available only on the iOS mobile app.
4. The clock icon will indicate how long your recording will take based on the words per minute set in the Teleprompter settings (default: 150 words per minute). Save your script for later, or press the camera button at the bottom of your screen to start recording your video while simultaneously reading the script from the teleprompter.

### On the Web Platform:
1. Head over to [BIGVU Web Platform](https://faq.bigvu.tv/en/articles/desk.bigvu.tv) and log in.
2. Click on the "New Script" button on the project page.
3. Enter your script's headline. This will later be the name of your entire project.
4. Type or copy and paste your script in the script box.
5. When you are satisfied with your script, you can:
   - Read & Record: Read your script from the teleprompter while recording.
   - Read Only: Practice reading your script from the teleprompter without recording.

1.original_question: how do I install open vpn?
1.answer:
To install OpenVPN Connect on Windows, follow these steps:

1. Download the [OpenVPN Connect app from our website](https://openvpn.net/client/client-connect-vpn-for-windows/).
2. Wait until the download completes, then open it.
3. Run the OpenVPN Connect setup wizard.
4. Agree to the EULA and install.
5. When prompted, click Yes to approve the privilege escalation request.
6. Click Finish when the installation completes.
7. From your system tray, click the OpenVPN Connect icon to launch the app.

For more detailed instructions, you can refer to the [installation guide](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/installation-guide-windows.html).

If you need to install OpenVPN Connect on other platforms like Android or iOS, you can find the respective guides [here for Android](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/android-installation-guide.html) and [here for iOS](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/ios-installation-guide.html).

It is built on the open-source OpenVPN core and is compatible with various Linux operating systems.

1.original_question: how do i setup access control for access server
1.answer:
To set up access control for Access Server, you can configure it at three levels: global, group, and user. Here’s a brief overview of how to do it:

### Global Access Control
1. Sign in to the Admin Web UI.
2. Click **Configuration > VPN Settings**.
3. Under **Routing**, set it to **Yes, using NAT**.
4. For the private subnets, enter the subnet for your resource (e.g., "10.0.0.1/32" for a print server).

### Group Access Control
1. Sign in to the Admin Web UI.
2. Click **User Management > Group Permissions**.
3. For the group you want to grant access, click **More Settings**.
4. In the **Access Control** section, set **Use Access Control** to **Yes**.
5. Under **Allow Access To networks and services**, enter subnets as network/nbits or services as network/nbits:services.
6. Click **Save Settings and Update Running Server**.

### User Access Control
1. Sign in to the Admin Web UI.
2. Click **User Management > User Permissions**.
3. For the user you want to grant access, click **More Settings**.
4. In the **Access Control** section, select **Use NAT** for the addressing method.
5. For **Allow Access To these Networks**, enter the subnet for your resource (e.g., "10.0.0.3/32" for a prod web server).

For more detailed steps and examples, you can refer to the [Managing Access Control In Access Server](https://openvpn.net/vpn-server-resources/access-control-as/) documentation.

3.original_question: Docker
3.answer:
Thanks for letting me know you're using Docker!

To download and set up OpenVPN Access Server in a Docker environment, follow these steps:

1. **Pull the Docker Image**: Use the command `docker pull openvpn/openvpn-as` to pull the latest OpenVPN Access Server Docker image.

2. **Run the Docker Container**: Execute the following command to run the container:
   ```sh
   docker run -d --name openvpn-as \
   -v /your/local/path:/config \
   -p 943:943 \
   -p 9443:9443 \
   -p 1194:1194/udp \
   --restart always \
   openvpn/openvpn-as
   ```

3. **Access the Admin UI**: Once the container is running, you can access the Admin UI by navigating to `` in your web browser.

For a detailed video guide, you can check out the OpenVPN Access Server Docker Setup Video.

If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!

1.original_question: how do I download OpenVPN?
1.answer:
To download OpenVPN Connect, follow these steps:

1. Visit the [OpenVPN Connect download page](https://openvpn.net/client/client-connect-vpn-for-windows/).
2. Wait for the download to complete, then open the downloaded file.
3. Run the OpenVPN Connect setup wizard.
4. Agree to the EULA and install.
5. When prompted, click Yes to approve the privilege escalation request.
6. Click Finish when the installation completes.
7. From your system tray, click the OpenVPN Connect icon to launch the app.

For more details, you can refer to the [installation guide](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/installation-guide-windows.html).

2.original_question: how do I install?
2.answer:
To install OpenVPN Connect on Windows, follow these steps:

1. Download the [OpenVPN Connect app from our website](https://openvpn.net/client/client-connect-vpn-for-windows/).
2. Wait until the download completes, then open it.
3. Run the OpenVPN Connect setup wizard.
4. Agree to the EULA and install.
5. When prompted, click Yes to approve the privilege escalation request.
6. Click Finish when the installation completes.
7. From your system tray, click the OpenVPN Connect icon to launch the app.

For more details, you can refer to the full installation guide [here](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/installation-guide-windows.html).

If you need to install it on macOS, follow these steps:

1. Download the [OpenVPN Connect app from our website](https://openvpn.net/client-connect-vpn-for-mac-os/).
2. Wait until the download completes, then open it.
3. Select the installer for your device (mac with Intel processor or mac with Apple chip).
4. Click Continue when the installer window opens.
5. Agree to the EULA and install.
6. When prompted, enter your device password to install.
7. Click Close when the installation completes.
8. You're prompted if you want to move the installation file to the trash; you can click Move to Trash.
9. From your Applications, click the OpenVPN Connect icon to launch the app.
10. Click through the tutorial and agree to the EULA.

For more details, you can refer to the full installation guide [here](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/macos-installation-guide.html).

3.original_question: how do I install connexa?
3.answer:
To install a Connector for CloudConnexa, follow these steps:

1. Sign in to the CloudConnexa Administration portal at [https://cloud.openvpn.com](https://cloud.openvpn.com/).
2. Navigate to Networks and select the network you want to connect.
3. Click the Connectors tab and then click the Deploy drop-down menu of the Connector you wish to modify.
4. Select Deploy Connector.
5. Choose the appropriate Connector type (e.g., macOS, pfSense, etc.) and follow the specific instructions for that type.

For a detailed guide on installing a Connector on macOS, you can refer to the [Tutorial: Install a Connector on macOS](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/tutorials/configuration-tutorials/connectors/operating-systems/macos/tutorial--install-a-connector-on-macos.html).

For configuring a pfSense router, refer to the [Tutorial: Configure a PfSense Router To Connect to CloudConnexa](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/tutorials/configuration-tutorials/connectors/routers/tutorial--configure-a-pfsense-router-to-connect-to-cloudconnexa.html).

If you need more information on adding a network for secure internet access, check out the [Add a Network for secure internet access](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/networks/networks---networks/add-a-network-for-secure-internet-access.html) guide.

Nas últimas décadas, a cidade passou por um notável crescimento, consolidando-se como um destino cada vez mais procurado para quem deseja adquirir imóveis na região.
As praias de Praia Grande são o atrativo principal da localidade. Com sua extensa faixa de areia dourada e águas cristalinas, elas proporcionam o cenário perfeito para uma variedade de atividades, como banhos de sol e esportes aquáticos. Praias renomadas, como a Guilhermina, Boqueirão, Canto do Forte e Ocian, oferecem opções para todos os gostos, desde a tranquilidade até a agitação.
Em resumo, Praia Grande, SP, é uma cidade que combina a beleza natural de suas praias com bairros atraentes e uma notável valorização dos imóveis nos últimos anos, tornando-a uma opção sólida para investidores e compradores que desejam adquirir imóveis em Praia Grande e desfrutar do paraíso do litoral paulista. 
Explore imóveis próximos aos destinos turísiticos mais deslumbrantes de Praia, Grande, litoral sul do estado de São Paulo! Descubra a combinação perfeita entre conforto e paisagens incrtíveis.

1.original_question: Can I copy and paste my script into bigvu?
1.answer:
Yes, you can copy and paste your script into BIGVU. Here's how you can do it:

### On the Mobile App:
1. Click on the "+" button in the center of the bottom menu and choose "New Script."
2. Enter your Project title. This will also be the name of the video you create from the script.
3. Type in your own script or copy and paste it into the text box.

### On the Web Platform:
1. Head over to the [BIGVU Web platform](https://faq.bigvu.tv/en/articles/desk.bigvu.tv) and log in.
2. Click on the "New Script" button on the project page.
3. Enter your script's headline. This will later be the name of your entire project.
4. Type or copy and paste your script in the script box.

Once you have your script in place, you can start recording using the teleprompter or make further edits as needed.

2.original_question: Docker
2.answer:
Thanks for asking! To set up access control for Access Server, you can use SAML for specific users and groups. Here's a quick overview:

1. Sign in to your Admin Web UI.
2. Click Authentication > SAML and ensure you have the information saved for your IdP.
3. Enable SAML by clicking the toggle for Enable SAML authentication.
4. Assign it to users or groups:
   - For users: Click User Management > User Permissions, click More Settings, and select SAML under Auth method.
   - For groups: Click User Management > Group Permissions, click More Settings, and select SAML under Auth method.

For more details, check out the [tutorial on setting SAML for specific users and groups](https://openvpn.net/as-docs/tutorials/saml-users-groups.html).

1.original_question: can I make horizontal videos
1.answer:
Yes, you can definitely make horizontal videos with BIGVU! Here's how you can do it:

1. **Decide on the Orientation**: Make sure your phone's rotation is enabled. You can check the settings on your phone to ensure this. For more details, you can refer to the [Instructions for Apple](https://intercom.help/bigvu/en/articles/3577255-how-to-enable-and-disable-orientation-lock-on-ios-devices) or [Instructions for Android](https://intercom.help/bigvu/en/articles/3577258-how-to-enable-and-disable-auto-rotate-screen-on-android).

2.

**Start a New Project**: Click the plus icon to open a new project. You have three choices to record a new video:
   - **Record No Script**: Record directly without a script.
   - **AI Magic Writer**: Use AI to help you write a business script and then record with a teleprompter.
   - **New Script**: Write a script from scratch and record with a teleprompter.

3. **Enable Auto-Rotate on Android**: If you're using an Android device, ensure that auto-rotate is on. You can do this by:
   - Opening the notification bar and finding "Auto-rotate" in the Quick Settings menu.
   - Alternatively, go to Settings > Display > System and turn on Auto-Rotate.

4.

**Change Aspect Ratio**: After recording, you can change the aspect ratio of your video to horizontal (16:9) using the BIGVU app. This is the standard YouTube aspect ratio and is perfect for landscape mode.

Would you like to give it a try on your project?

2.original_question: Where can I change aspect ratio
2.answer:
You can change the aspect ratio of your video using BIGVU on both the web and mobile platforms.

### On the Web:
1. Go to [https://desk.bigvu.tv](http://desk.bigvu.tv/) and select the video you want to edit.
2. Click on the three dots menu and choose "Edit."
3. In the Take Screen, select the desired take by clicking the three-dot menu beneath its name.
4. Choose "Open Video Maker" to stylize your video.
5. Click on the "Style" button on the left sidebar and choose "Resize."
6. You can then choose to crop or add blurred banners to your video.

### On Mobile:
1. Create or import your video by clicking on the "+" icon in the center of the bottom menu.
2. On the projects page, click on the thumbnail of your video.
3. Select one of the themes in the Magic Style area and choose the "Style without captions" option.
4. The first step of the workflow is changing the ratio of your video. Choose the ratio based on where you plan to share your video:
   - 16:9 (horizontal) for YouTube.
   - 1:1 (square) for social media platforms like Instagram.

*Want to try out Video Translation? Just click [here](https://bigvu.sng.link/Db284/ot3k?wpsrc=button&_smtype=3&utm_medium=chatbot&utm_source=bigvu.tv&utm_content=video_translator&utm_campaign=edit_tools&_fallback_redirect=https://desk.bigvu.tv/welcome/init/upload)*

1.original_question: how do I configure 2FA for Access Server?
1.answer:
Thanks for asking! To configure 2FA for your OpenVPN Access Server, you can use Duo's two-factor authentication. Here's a brief overview of the steps:

1. Sign in to the Duo Admin Panel and click Applications.
2. Click Protect an Application, then find OpenVPN Access Server and click Protect.
3. Note the integration key, secret key, and API key displayed.
4. Download the Duo OpenVPN Access Server package from the duo_openvpn_as GitHub repository.
5. Follow the instructions to integrate Duo with your Access Server.

For more detailed steps, refer to the [Add Duo Two-Factor Authentication To OpenVPN Access Server](https://openvpn.net/vpn-server-resources/add-duo-2fa-to-openvpn-access-server/) documentation.

1.original_question: Can you create a script for a 30 minute video?
1.answer:
Creating a script for a 30-minute video using BIGVU's AI Magic Writer might be a bit challenging, as the AI tool is designed to generate shorter scripts quickly. However, you can create multiple shorter scripts and combine them to fit your 30-minute video.

Here's how you can get started:

1. **Choose a Template**: Decide on the type of video you want to create. BIGVU offers templates for business pitches, sales proposals, news updates, industry tips, and more.

2.

**Generate Multiple Scripts**: Use the AI Magic Writer to generate several shorter scripts. You can do this by providing different prompts or breaking down your 30-minute content into smaller sections.

3. **Combine and Edit**: Once you have generated multiple scripts, you can combine them into one cohesive script. Edit the combined script to ensure it flows well and covers all the points you want to make.

4. **Customize the Length and Tone**: Adjust the length and tone of each section to ensure consistency throughout your video.

To generate a script using the AI Magic Writer on the web platform, log in and click on the "New Script" button on the Projects page. Enter the title of your script and use the "AI Rewrite Button" to access the AI Magic Writer.

For more detailed steps, you can refer to the [How to write a video script with AI or from scratch](https://faq.bigvu.tv/en/articles/7191767-how-to-write-a-video-script-with-ai-or-from-scratch) guide.

1.original_question: how to do the device verification in cloudconnexa
1.answer:
To perform device verification in CloudConnexa, you can use the Device Identity Verification & Enforcement (DIVE) feature. This feature minimizes your network attack surface and gives admins full visibility into devices by limiting authenticated user access to trusted devices with unique digital identities.

For more details, you can refer to the [Cloud Connexa documentation](https://openvpn.net/for/secure-dns/).

10.original_question: can i user ldap and saml
10.answer:
CloudConnexa supports only one form of user authentication at a time. You can choose between CloudConnexa (Username/Password), SAML, or LDAP, but you cannot use LDAP and SAML simultaneously.

11.original_question: how to create a new user
11.answer:
To create a new user in CloudConnexa, follow these steps:

1. Navigate to Users > Users.
2. Click Add User.
3. Provide a unique username. An email address can be used as a username.
4. Select a User Group from the drop-down list.
5. Select a role from the drop-down list. If Admin is selected, providing an email is mandatory.
6. Optionally, provide the first name and last name of the person.
7. Optionally, provide the person's email if Member is the chosen role. An email address is needed if you want the person to receive an invitation email with a temporary password and steps to get connected.

For more details, you can refer to the [Add a User](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/users/users---users/add-a-user.html) documentation.

14.answer:
To check the logs on CloudConnexa, you can follow these steps:

1. **For Pfsense Router:**
   - **Option 1:** Access the logs from the Pfsense Router Admin GUI by navigating to **Status > System Logs > OpenVPN**.
   - **Option 2:** Use SSH to access the Pfsense Router, select the Shell, and execute the command:
     ```
     cat /var/log/openvpn.log | grep "Nov 28"
     ```

2. **For AWS S3 Bucket:**
   - If you have configured CloudConnexa Log Streaming to an AWS S3 bucket, you can check the logs by accessing your S3 bucket. Ensure that you have set up the necessary permissions and configurations as outlined in the [AWS S3 bucket configuration tutorial](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/tutorials/configuration-tutorials/log-streaming/tutorial--configure-aws-s3-bucket-for-cloudconnexa-log-streaming.html).

3.

**Pause Log Streaming:**
   - If you need to pause log streaming temporarily, navigate to **API & Logs > Log Streaming** and click **Pause**. The status will change to Paused within several minutes.

For more detailed instructions, you can refer to the respective tutorials and documentation.

[How to Get the OpenVPN Logs of Pfsense Router](https://support.openvpn.com/hc/en-us/articles/4411393493403-CloudConnexa-How-to-Get-the-OpenVPN-Logs-of-Pfsense-Router)

[Tutorial: Configure AWS S3 bucket for CloudConnexa Log Streaming](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/tutorials/configuration-tutorials/log-streaming/tutorial--configure-aws-s3-bucket-for-cloudconnexa-log-streaming.html)

[Pause Log Streaming](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/api---logs/api---logs---log-streaming/pause-log-streaming.html)

Editing your videos by trimming them using words is a feature called WordTrim in BIGVU. This tool allows you to cut your videos based on the words in your transcript. Here's how it works:

1. **Automatic Transcription**: When you record a video, BIGVU automatically transcribes it.
2.

**Select Words**: You can then select the word where you want your video to start and the last word you want to hear before the video ends.
3. **Effortless Editing**: This method makes it easy to identify and keep the highlights of your narration without having to go through the entire video.

This feature is available on both the web and mobile app. On the web, you can trim videos under your Script Project by selecting the take you want to style and choosing "Trim Video" from the 3-dots menu. On mobile, you can fine-tune the start and end points by clicking on new words or using the "Start & End" or "Full Video" modes for minor or major adjustments.

2.original_question: how do you read without moving your eyes
2.answer:
To read from the BIGVU teleprompter without moving your eyes too much, follow these tips:

1. **Text Size**: Keep the text as close to the camera as possible and make the font size small enough to read comfortably. This helps maintain eye contact with the camera.
2. **Reading Position**: Always read the top lines of the script, as they are closest to the camera. Avoid reading the bottom lines as they come into view, as this will take your eyes away from the camera.
3. **Teleprompter Speed**: Adjust the teleprompter speed to match your natural speaking pace. This allows you to read the top lines smoothly without rushing or lagging.

Practicing these steps will help you maintain eye contact and make your videos look more professional and engaging.

2. **Open Teleprompter and Select Effects**: Open the BIGVU Teleprompter App. Once inside, locate the "effects" option. This is where you can choose from various filters to enhance your appearance.

**Set the Filter**: Before you start recording, use the slider to set the filter to your liking. You can choose from beauty effects, makeup filters, reshaping options, and background blur.

**Record or Broadcast Live**: Keep eye contact with the camera while reading the script from the teleprompter. This helps you look and sound like a true professional.

5.

**Adjust as Needed**: If the scrolling speed of the teleprompter isn't right, you can adjust it while recording by pressing the Plus or Minus buttons. You can also switch between your front and back camera before or during your recording by clicking the reverse camera icon.

6.

**Finish and Edit**: Once you finish recording, you can re-record if needed or proceed to edit your video using BIGVU’s built-in editor. Add subtitles, captions, music, and more to polish your video.

3.original_question: how do you make your own script?
3.answer:
Creating your own script with BIGVU is straightforward. Here's how you can do it:

### On the Mobile App:

1. **Click on the "+" button** in the center of the bottom menu and choose "New Script".
2. **Enter your Project title**. This will also be the name of the video you create from the script.
3.

**Type in your own script** or upload an existing script into the text box. Note that the upload option is currently available only on the iOS mobile app.
4. The clock icon will indicate how long your recording will take based on the words per minute set in the Teleprompter settings (default: 150 words per minute).
5. Save your script for later, or press the camera button at the bottom of your screen to start recording your video while simultaneously reading the script from the teleprompter.

### On the Web Platform:

1. **Log in** to [BIGVU](https://desk.bigvu.tv) and click on the "New Script" button on the project page.
2.

**Enter your script's headline**. This will later be the name of your entire project.
3.

**Type or copy and paste your script** in the script box.
4. When you are satisfied with your script, you can:
   - **Read & Record**: Read your script from the teleprompter while recording.
   - **Read Only**: Practice reading your script from the teleprompter without recording.

Congrats! You've created your first script! 🥳

1.original_question: script for practicing youtube vedio
1.answer:
Creating a script for practicing your YouTube video is easy with BIGVU! Here's how you can do it:

1. **Using the AI Magic Writer**:
   - **Mobile App**: Click on the "+" button in the center of the bottom menu and choose "AI Magic Writer".
   - **Web Platform**: [Log in](https://desk.bigvu.tv/login) and click on the "New Script" button on the Projects page. Enter the "Title of the script" and click on the "AI Rewrite Button" to access the AI Magic Writer.

2. **Choose the Type of Script**:
   - You can create various types of scripts such as "My Business Profile", "My News Flash", "Expert Tips", "Tailored Sales Pitch", "Blog to Vlog", and "Video Sales Letter".

3. **Generate and Edit Your Script**:
   - Enter a few short words or a sentence about your topic. The AI Magic Writer will generate three proposed scripts.
   - Choose to delete, add to your script box, or add to your whiteboard.
   - Edit or add more AI scripts to the script box until you are satisfied.

4. **Practice Your Script**:
   - **Read & Record**: Read your script from the teleprompter while recording.
   - **Read Only**: Practice reading your script from the teleprompter without recording. Your microphone and camera will be off while you practice.
   - **Live Stream**: Read from the teleprompter while broadcasting live on social media.

1.original_question: how do I download OpenVPN?
1.answer:
To download OpenVPN Connect, follow these steps:

1. Visit the [OpenVPN Connect download page](https://openvpn.net/client/client-connect-vpn-for-windows/).
2. Wait for the download to complete, then open the downloaded file.
3. Run the OpenVPN Connect setup wizard.
4. Agree to the EULA and install.
5. When prompted, click Yes to approve the privilege escalation request.
6. Click Finish when the installation completes.
7. From your system tray, click the OpenVPN Connect icon to launch the app.

For more details, you can refer to the [installation guide](https://openvpn.net/connect-docs/installation-guide-windows.html).

1.answer:
Yes, you can change the language of subtitles in BIGVU! Here's how you can do it:

1. **Choose the Video**: Find your video on the main projects page. Click on the three dots below the thumbnail and choose "Edit."

2. **Generate the Captions**: Click on the three dots icon under the take to which you want to add subtitles. Choose "Open Video Maker," then select "Add Auto Subtitles" and choose the language of your video and corresponding captions. Click "Select."

3. **Translate Subtitles**: After generating the captions, you can translate them into a different language. Click on the three dots under your script project and choose "edit." On the take screen, choose the take to which you would like to add translated subtitles and click on the three dots. Choose "Generate Subtitles and Translations," then select the Translate option. Choose the original language of your video and the languages you want to translate to. You can select multiple languages simultaneously.

This feature is available for AI Pro and Teams Subscribers on both the web platform and mobile app.

3.original_question: what is an application
3.answer:
In the context of Connexa, an application refers to a specific SaaS tool or service that is configured using its domain name. This configuration allows traffic to the SaaS application to enter the Wide-area Private Cloud (WPC) and exit from the connected networks associated with the configured applications. For example, Salesforce and Zendesk can be configured as applications within Connexa to enforce role-based access control and ensure that only authorized users can access these services through the secure network.

For more details, you can refer to the [Tutorial: Restrict Login Access to SaaS With Whitelisting and Without Backhauling All Internet Traffic](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/tutorials/use-case-tutorials/saas-security/tutorial--restrict-login-access-to-saas-with-whitelisting-and-without-backhauling-all-internet-traffic.html).

3. Tap on "My Subscription," and you will see your current plan.

2.original_question: how to connect my network to cloudconnexa
2.answer:
To connect your network to CloudConnexa, follow these steps:

1. Configure your network with the office network subnet using the Administration portal.
2. Install the Connector on your Windows Server and connect to CloudConnexa.

4. Configure LAN routing on your Windows Server.

3.original_question: what is host
3.answer:
A Host represents a server on your private network running a Connector to provide connectivity to CloudConnexa. It can be an application server, computer, NAS, or any device that can set up an OpenVPN tunnel. The Host is reachable by the tunnel IP address(es) assigned to its Connector(s) and, if a domain name is provided, also accessible via that domain name.

For more details, you can refer to the [documentation](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/hosts/hosts---hosts/about-hosts.html).

4.original_question: how to connect a host
4.answer:
To connect a host to CloudConnexa, you need to add a Connector to the Host. Here are the steps:

1. Sign in to the CloudConnexa Administration portal.
2. Navigate to Hosts > Connectors.
3. Click "Add Connector."
4. Provide a Name for the Connector.
5. Optionally, provide a Description.
6. Select the Host for the Connector from the Host drop-down.
7. Change the default Region shown to the closest to the application server's location if needed.
8. Click "Add Connector."

For more detailed instructions, you can refer to the [Add a Connector to a Host](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/hosts/hosts---connectors/add-a-connector-to-a-host.html) documentation.

If you need to install a Connector on macOS, follow the steps in the [Tutorial: Install a Connector on macOS](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/tutorials/configuration-tutorials/connectors/operating-systems/macos/tutorial--install-a-connector-on-macos.html).

For downloading the Host Connector's connection profile as a .ovpn file, refer to [Download a Host Connector's connection profile as a .ovpn file](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/hosts/hosts---connectors/download-a-host-connector-s-connection-profile-as-a--ovpn-file.html).

1.original_question: what is location context policy
1.answer:
The Location Context Policy in OpenVPN's CloudConnexa allows or blocks connections based on the IP address of the connecting device. It can be configured to match IP address ranges or countries using IP address geolocation. This policy enhances security and helps comply with regulations.

For more details, you can refer to the [About Location Context Policy](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/users/users---location-context/about-location-context-policy.html) document.

4.original_question: how is this different from DIVE
4.answer:
The Location Context Policy and Device Identity Verification & Enforcement (DIVE) serve different purposes in OpenVPN's CloudConnexa.

- **Location Context Policy**: This policy allows or blocks connections based on the IP address or geographic location of the connecting device. It enhances security by ensuring that only devices from specific IP ranges or countries can connect.

- **DIVE**: This feature ensures that only authorized devices can connect by locking the device profile to the device's identity (UUID). It prevents unauthorized devices from using the connection profile to access the network.

For more details, you can refer to the [Location Context Policy documentation](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/users/users---location-context/about-location-context-policy.html) and the [DIVE policy documentation](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/settings/settings---users/set-the-device-identity-verification---enforcement--dive--policy-for-users.html).

5.original_question: what is dco
5.answer:
Data Channel Offload (DCO) in OpenVPN's CloudConnexa improves the performance of the OpenVPN tunnel by offloading data packet processing from the OpenVPN userspace program to the Linux kernel. This allows OpenVPN to utilize low-level Linux APIs and avoid slow payload transfers between kernel and user spaces, enhancing overall tunnel performance.

For more details, you can refer to the [OpenVPN Support Center](https://support.openvpn.com/hc/en-us/articles/4406065258523-CloudConnexa-How-to-enable-DCO-on-a-Linux-connector).

9.original_question: how to configure my own DNS servers in Access server
9.answer: What Access Server environment are you asking about?

prod_rewite.text: how to configure custom DNS servers in Access Server

DcR_rewrite.text: how to configure my own DNS servers in access server

10.answer:
Thanks for using Ubuntu! To configure your own DNS servers in Access Server, follow these steps:

1. Disable full tunnel routing:
   ```bash
   sudo su
   cd /usr/local/openvpn_as/scripts
   ./sacli --key "vpn.client.routing.reroute_gw" --value "false" ConfigPut
   ```

2. Disable Global DNS:
   ```bash
   ./sacli --key "vpn.client.routing.reroute_dns" --value "false" ConfigPut
   ```

3. Define the DNS Servers per User/Group. For example, to assign DNS servers 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4 for the "test" user:
   ```bash
   echo 'push "dhcp-option DNS 8.8.4.4"' > file.txt
   echo 'push "dhcp-option DNS 8.8.8.8"' >> file.txt
   ./sacli --user test -k prop_cc_cmds --value_file=./file.txt UserPropPut
   ```

4. Save the changes:
   ```bash
   ./sacli start
   ```

For more details, refer to the [Access Server: configure multiple DNS servers per user/group](https://support.openvpn.com/hc/en-us/articles/5434430050459-Access-Server-configure-multiple-DNS-servers-per-user-group) documentation.

12.original_question: what is the difference between access server and cloudconnexa
12.answer:
Thanks for asking! 

OpenVPN Access Server is a self-hosted solution that simplifies secure remote access deployment with a web-based GUI and built-in OpenVPN Connect Client installer. It allows complete control over deployment, configuration, and management, and is ideal for environments where you need the tunnel to terminate on networks you own and control.

Cloud Connexa, on the other hand, is a cloud-based service that provides secure communication for distributed workforces and IoT/IIoT devices. It offers a virtualized network with built-in security functions and is managed by OpenVPN Inc., making it easier to deploy and maintain.

For more details, you can check the [OpenVPN Product Comparison](https://openvpn.net/product-comparison/).

prod_rewite.text: difference between Access Server and CloudConnexa

DcR_rewrite.text: what is the difference between access server and cloudconnexa

13.answer:
Both OpenVPN Access Server and Cloud Connexa offer robust features, but they cater to different needs. OpenVPN Access Server is a self-hosted solution that provides complete control over deployment, configuration, and management. It includes features like user-level Access Control Lists (ACL), syslog collection, and the ability to use RADIUS or PAM for authentication.

Cloud Connexa, on the other hand, is a cloud-based service that offers built-in security functions, content filtering, and Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS). It also allows for easy connection to multiple private networks and provides access to applications without exposing the network.

For a detailed comparison, you can refer to the [Product Comparison Table](https://openvpn.net).

For more information on Cloud Connexa, visit [Cloud Connexa](https://openvpn.net/cloud-vpn/).

For more information on Access Server, visit [Access Server](https://openvpn.net/access-server/).

1.original_question:
La llegada de los españoles al área que hoy es Ibagué se remonta al siglo XVI, en el contexto de la colonización del territorio que ahora es Colombia. En 1550, el conquistador español Andrés López de Galarza fundó la ciudad de Ibagué bajo el nombre de "Villa de San Bonifacio de Ibagué". La ciudad fue establecida el 14 de octubre de 1550 en el valle del Cacique Ibagué, en la región del Tolima.

En esta región habitaban diversas comunidades indígenas, entre ellas los pijaos, quienes resistieron ferozmente la invasión española. La fundación de Ibagué se realizó como parte de la expansión colonial hacia el interior del país, con el objetivo de establecer un control más efectivo sobre las rutas comerciales y el acceso a recursos naturales.

Ibagué fue inicialmente ubicada en lo que hoy es el municipio de Cajamarca, pero debido a los constantes ataques de los indígenas pijaos, fue trasladada en 1551 a su ubicación actual en el Valle de Las Lanzas. La ciudad se convirtió en un punto estratégico para la colonización y la evangelización de las regiones circundantes.

La llegada de los españoles a Ibagué marcó el inicio de un período de cambios significativos para las comunidades indígenas, que enfrentaron la pérdida de sus tierras, la imposición de nuevas estructuras sociales y religiosas, y la explotación de sus recursos por parte de los colonizadores.

6.original_question: what is data channel offload and how can i enable it
6.answer:
Data Channel Offload (DCO) improves performance by offloading data channel encryption and decryption to the kernel space, reducing the need for copy operations between kernel and user spaces and utilizing multi-threading.

To enable DCO:

1. Ensure your Access Server is version 2.12.0 or newer.
2. Install the DCO module on your server:
   - For Debian/Ubuntu: `apt install openvpn-dco-dkms`
   - For RHEL: `yum install kmod-ovpn-dco`
3. Enable DCO in the Admin Web UI:
   - Sign in to the Admin Web UI.
   - Go to Configuration > Advanced VPN.
   - Set "Prefer kernel Openvpn data channel offloading if available (ovpn-dco)" to Yes.

For a detailed tutorial, you can refer to the [Tutorial: Turn on OpenVPN DCO](https://openvpn.net/as-docs/tutorials/tutorial--turn-on-openvpn-dco.html).

You can also watch a comprehensive video on [OpenVPN Data Channel Offload in Action](https://openvpn.net/as-docs/videos/video--dco-in-action.html).

1.original_question: I have another phone that I sometimes use why can't I use the app on my newer phone?
1.answer:
If you're having trouble using BIGVU on your newer phone, it might be due to the screen refresh rate. Many new Android devices have a 120 Hz refresh rate, but BIGVU currently requires a 60 Hz refresh rate to function properly. 

To fix this, you can adjust your phone's settings:

1. Go to Device Settings and search for "Motion smoothness."
2. Tap on "Motion smoothness" again and select "Standard refresh rate" (60 Hz).

BIGVU will support 120 Hz soon.

1.original_question: how can i cancel a monthly subscription?
1.answer:
To cancel your monthly subscription with BIGVU, you'll need to follow the steps based on the platform you used to subscribe. Here are the instructions:

### If you subscribed via Google Play (Android):
1. Make sure you're signed into the Google account you used to sign up for BIGVU.
2. Go to your [Google Play Subscriptions](https://play.google.com/store/account/subscriptions).
3. Find BIGVU Teleprompter & Video Captions under your active subscriptions.
4. Choose to Pause payments or Cancel Subscription.

### If you subscribed via the Apple App Store (iOS):
1. Enter the subscription page in the app store. [You can do so here](https://apps.apple.com/account/subscriptions).
2. Find BIGVU Teleprompter under your active subscriptions.
3. Click on the Teleprompter BIGVU and choose "Cancel Subscription" or "Cancel Free Trial". After confirming the cancellation, your plan will not be renewed.

### If you subscribed via the BIGVU Website:
1. Log in to your account on the [BIGVU website](https://desk.bigvu.tv).
2. Click on the Profile Icon at the top right and select "Billing" from the dropdown menu.
3. In the billing screen, choose "cancel".

After canceling, your plan will revert back to a Free account at the end of your billing cycle, and your videos will be stored locally.

1.original_question: how to install more connector on cloudconnexa
1.answer:
To install more connectors on CloudConnexa, follow these steps:

1. Navigate to Hosts > Connectors.
2. Click Add Connector.
3. Provide the Name for the Connector.
4. Optionally, provide a Description.
5. Select the Host for the Connector from the Host drop-down.
6. Change the default Region shown to the closest to the application server's location if needed.
7. Click Add Connector.

For more detailed instructions, you can refer to the [Add a Connector to a Host](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/hosts/hosts---connectors/add-a-connector-to-a-host.html) documentation.

2.original_question: what is traffic filtering
2.answer:
Traffic filtering on CloudConnexa involves monitoring traffic and matching it to traffic signatures of malicious traffic and other traffic of interest. It classifies traffic into three threat priority levels: Critical, High, and Medium. Additionally, traffic signatures are categorized into nine types based on the nature of the threat, such as Malware and Ransomware, Intrusion Activity, and Phishing.

For more details, you can refer to the [Traffic Filtering Priorities, Categories, and Protection Levels](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/shield/about-cyber-shield/traffic-filtering-priorities,-categories,-and-protection-levels.html) documentation.

6.original_question: what is wpc
6.answer:
The Wide-area Private Cloud (WPC) on CloudConnexa is a secure, reliable, multi-tenant, virtualized network-as-a-service (NaaS). It creates a virtually dedicated worldwide private network exclusively for your use, identified by a unique Cloud ID. This network connects your corporate applications, data centers, other sites, the internet, and public resources like SaaS applications.

For more details, you can refer to the [Introduction to CloudConnexa](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/get-started/about-cloudconnexa/introduction-to-cloudconnexa.html) and [About Wide-area Private Cloud (WPC)](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/get-started/about-cloudconnexa/about-wide-area-private-cloud--wpc-.html).

10.original_question: how to share applications between multiple wpcs
10.answer:
To share applications between multiple WPCs on CloudConnexa, follow these steps:

1. Log in to your WPC's Administration portal by entering your WPC's Cloud ID in the address bar of your web browser.
2. Navigate to AppHub.
3. In the App Provider tab, find the application you want to share and click "Share Application."
4. Enter the Cloud ID or email address of the invitee WPC.
5. Optionally, add a description or internal notes.
6. Click "Send Invitation."

The invitee will receive an email invitation to approve access to the shared application.

For more details, you can refer to the [App Provider Sends an Invitation To Share an Application](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/apphub/app-provider-sends-an-invitation-to-share-an-application.html) and [Invitee Approves Access To Shared Application](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/apphub/invitee-approves-access-to-shared-application.html) documentation.

11.original_question: how can i install access server on ubuntu
11.answer:
Thanks! To install Access Server on Ubuntu, follow these steps:

1. Update your package list:
   ```bash
   sudo apt-get update
   ```

2. Install the necessary packages:
   ```bash
   sudo apt-get install -y ca-certificates wget net-tools gnupg
   ```

3. Download and add the OpenVPN Access Server repository key:
   ```bash
   wget -O -  | sudo apt-key add -
   ```

4. Add the OpenVPN Access Server repository:
   ```bash
   sudo sh -c 'echo "deb  focal main" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/openvpn-as-repo.list'
   ```

5. Update your package list again:
   ```bash
   sudo apt-get update
   ```

6. Install the OpenVPN Access Server package:
   ```bash
   sudo apt-get install -y openvpn-as
   ```

7. After installation, you can access the Admin Web UI by navigating to `https://[your-server-ip]:943/admin` in your web browser.

For more details, you can refer to the OpenVPN Access Server Installation Guide documentation.

Este impuesto es recaudado y transferido al estado

Thanks for letting me know!

To connect to Access Server using Docker on Windows, follow these steps:

1. **Install Docker**: Ensure Docker is installed on your Windows machine.
2.

**Pull the Access Server Docker Image**: Use the command `docker pull openvpn/openvpn-as`.
3.

**Run the Docker Container**: Start the container with `docker run -d -v /your/local/config:/config -p 943:943 -p 9443:9443 -p 1194:1194/udp --name openvpn-as --restart always openvpn/openvpn-as`.
4.

**Access the Admin UI**: Open a web browser and go to `https://<your-docker-host-ip>:943/admin` to configure your Access Server.

For more detailed instructions, you can refer to the OpenVPN Access Server Docker documentation.

1.original_question: how do i setup access control for access server
1.answer:
To set up access control for an Access Server, you need to create Access Groups. Here’s a step-by-step guide:

1. Navigate to Access > Groups.
2. Click Add Access Group.
3. Provide a Name and, optionally, a Description.
4. Expand/Collapse and search the Hosts, Networks, and User Groups sections in the Source column to find the entity that you want to give access to.
5. Click on the check boxes of the source entities to select.
6. Expand/Collapse and search the Hosts, Networks, and User Groups sections in the Destination column to find the resources you want access to be granted. You will see an Applications shared with you section as a Destination if you have accepted access to shared applications using AppHub.
7. Click on the check boxes of destination resources to select.
8. Click Add Access Group.

### Important Notes:
- For Access Groups to take effect, the Topology of the WPC must be set to Custom.
- After adding an Access Group, delete the Default Full Mesh Access Group if it exists. The continued presence of the Default Full Mesh Access Group will make other Access Groups ineffective.

For more detailed information, you can refer to the documentation on [Add an Access Group to allow access](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/access/access---groups/add-an-access-group-to-allow-access.html).

If you need to set access control for Shared Applications, follow these steps:

1. Navigate to Access Groups.
2. Create a new Access Group.
3. You will see a new section called Applications Shared with You, containing Shared Applications from the various App Providers whose Invitations were accepted.
4. Select the appropriate Sources and Destinations to configure the desired access control.

For more details, refer to the documentation on [App Client Controls Access to the Shared Applications](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/apphub/app-client-controls-access-to-the-shared-applications.html).

4.original_question: how do i edit a user group for cloud connexa
4.answer:
To edit a User Group in CloudConnexa, follow these steps:

1. Navigate to **Users > Groups**. A table listing all the Groups will be displayed.
2. Click the edit icon on the row for the User Group you want to edit.
3. For **Group Name**, provide a unique name for the group.
4. For **Region**, if you want the Users belonging to the Group to only connect to a list of select Regions instead of all of them, change the default All Regions by unchecking Select All from the drop-down list and selecting the desired specific Regions.
5. For **Internet Access**, select the desired setting. To learn more about the different settings, refer to [About Internet Access configuration](https://openvpn.net/access/access---internet/about-internet-access-configuration.html).
6. For **Connect Auth**, the default setting can be overridden here. Refer to [Set the default connection authentication (Connect Auth) policy for Users](https://openvpn.net/settings/settings---users/set-the-default-connection-authentication--connect-auth--policy-for-users.html).
7. For **Max Devices Per User**, the default setting can be overridden here. Refer to [Set the default device allowance for Users](https://openvpn.net/settings/settings---users/set-the-default-device-allowance-for-users.html).
8. Click **Update Group**.

For more details, you can refer to the [Edit a User Group](https://openvpn.net/cloud-docs/owner/users/users---groups/edit-a-user-group.html) documentation.
